item.title: Selvi add a quote by William Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Things were easier for the old novelists who saw people all of a piece. Speaking generally, their heroes were good through and through, their villains wholly bad." -- William Somerset Maugham

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Swami Vivekananda
item.description: "You have to grow from the inside out. None can teach you, none can make you spiritual. There is no other teacher but your own soul." -- Swami Vivekananda

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Andrew Carnegie
item.description: "He that cannot reason is a fool. He that will not is a bigot. He that dare not is a slave." -- Andrew Carnegie

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Gene Fowler
item.description: "Writing is easy. You only need to stare at a blank piece of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead." -- Gene Fowler

item.title: Selvi add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "You don't write because you want to say something, you write because you have something to say." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Selvi add a quote by James Michener
item.description: "I love writing. I love the swirl and swing of words as they tangle with human emotions." -- James Michener

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It is, in fact, nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction have not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry; for this delicate little plant, aside from stimulation, stands mainly in need of freedom. Without this it goes to wrack and ruin without fail." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Indira Gandhi
item.description: "The power to question is the basis of all human progress." -- Indira Gandhi

item.title: Selvi add a quote by Emil Ludwig
item.description: "The decision to kiss for the first time is the most crucial in any love story. It changes the relationship of two people much more strongly than even the final surrender; because this kiss already has within it that surrender." -- Emil Ludwig
